newsitem.title: COLOMBIA: Rebels blast Colombia pipeline,second time in week.
newsitem.headline: Rebels blast Colombia pipeline,second time in week.

text.p: Leftist rebels dynamited Colombia's main Cano Limon-Covenas pipeline for the second time in four days early Thursday and forced Occidental Petroleum Corp to halt all production at its giant Cano Limon field, a company spokesman told Reuters.

The blast occurred at 0152 local time (0652 GMT) in the municipality of Arauquita in eastern Arauca province less than one hour after the pipeline was repaired and began pumping crude again after Sunday's dynmaite attack.

The new blast, however, meant that all storage capacity was now full and that Occidental is unable to pump any crude to the lifting terminal at the Caribbean coast port of Covenas until the 300,000 bpd capacity pipeline is in operation again.
Officials at the state-run oil company Ecopetrol were not immediately available for comment on the new incident.

The Cano Limon-Covenas pipeline has now been dynamited 37 times this year and about seven times since June 15. The attacks have been blamed on the National Liberation Army (ELN), Colombia's second largest rebel force which specializes in attacks on Colombia's oil infrastructure.
